a1: AES-256 is considered unbreakable by brute force with current technology. It is used by governments and military organizations worldwide.
q2: Can I decrypt on another device?
a2: Yes. Copy the encrypted output and paste it on any device with this tool. Use the same password to decrypt.
q3: What happens if I forget the password?
a3: The data cannot be recovered without the password. There is no backdoor or recovery mechanism.
q4: Is my data sent to a server?
a4: No. All encryption and decryption happens locally in your browser using the Web Crypto API.
a5: PBKDF2 (Password-Based Key Derivation Function 2) converts your password into a strong encryption key using 100,000 iterations of hashing with a random salt.
